result.execSummary:
The defendant Tramond Keshaun Maxwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharges. All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 06-26-2023 to convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.

- No driving without a valid driver's license or proof of insurance.
- No possession of firearms.
- No possession of illegal drugs.
COURT GRANTS EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE

- Absolute sobriety with random testing.
- Complete a Firearm Safety Course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tramond Keshaun Maxwell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tramond Keshaun Maxwell in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 75 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME. 
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no driving without a valid drivers license or proof of insurance
- no posession of firearms
- complete a firearm safety course
- no possession of illegal drugs

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 06/26/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Tramond Keshaun Maxwell in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense advises the Court this case is in resolution posture and requests a plea and sentencing date. 
Court orders matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Tramond Keshaun Maxwell in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
